subject: Re: [junit] NoSuchMethodError ?
msgSnippet: ... No such thing as junit.testui.TestRunner . You mean textui , with x , not s . -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
zetaray@... wrote:

> Guys
> I am new in junit; hope something can help me out here.
>
> I have an existing project that I want to add jUnit to it.
>
> My jUnit Test class is in the same folder of the class(a webapp's
> class, inside WEB-INF) I was planning to test (also using the
> same "package"). My junit.jar is in the classpath.
>
> When I tried to run the test using command "java com.test.junitTest",
> I got error like this.
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError:
> junit.testui.TestRunner.run(Ljunit/framework/Test;)V at .....
>
> What might be wrong with it ?

No such thing as "junit.testui.TestRunner". You mean "textui", with 'x',
not 's'.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
